step1.sentence: After losing her job, she decided to reinvent herself by going back to school and pursuing a career in design.

step2.story: Mark spent years climbing the corporate ladder, but burnout finally caught up with him. He took a sabbatical and used the time to reinvent himself as a freelance photographer. Now he wakes up excited to work every morning.

step3.story: At forty-two, Sarah stood at a crossroads. Two decades in finance had left her accomplished on paper but hollow inside. She had always painted in secret, filling sketchbooks she kept hidden under her bed. One gray November morning, she quit her job and began to reinvent herself from the ground up. She enrolled in an art program, sold her city apartment, and moved to a small coastal town where no one knew her old life. The process was terrifying and exhilarating at once—like shedding a skin she hadn't realized was suffocating her.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 자신을 완전히 새로운 방식으로 다시 만들거나 변형하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 직업, 이미지, 생활 방식 등을 근본적으로 바꾸어 새로운 자아를 만들어가는 것을 표현할 때 쓴다. 특히 큰 실패나 전환점 이후의 과감한 변화를 나타내는 맥락에서 자주 등장한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'reinvent'는 라틴어 'inventire(발견하다)'에서 온 'invent'에 반복·역전을 뜻하는 접두사 're-'가 붙은 형태로, '다시 발명하다'는 뜻이다. 'yourself'를 목적어로 취해 자기 자신을 대상으로 한 재창조를 의미하게 되었다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 변화(change)나 개선(improve)보다 훨씬 근본적이고 포괄적인 변신을 암시하며, 의지와 능동성이 강하게 담긴 표현이다. 약간의 드라마틱한 뉘앙스가 있어 자기계발이나 커리어 전환 담론에서 특히 많이 쓰인다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Moving abroad gave him the perfect opportunity to reinvent himself.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 해외로 이주한 것이 그에게 자신을 새롭게 만들 완벽한 기회가 되었다.
